channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-15504] Upgrade Maven and Maven Wagon versions
item.description:
I'm not even sure that Hadoop's combination of the relevant dependencies is vulnerable (even if they are, this is a relatively minor vulnerability), but this is at least showing up as an issue in automated vulnerability scans. Details can be found here https://maven.apache.org/security.html (CVE-2013-0253, CVE-2012-6153). Essentially the combination of maven 3.0.4 (we use 3.0, and I guess that maps to 3.0.4?) and older versions of wagon plugin don't use SSL properly (note that we neither use the WebDAV provider nor a 2.x version of the SSH plugin, which is why I suspect that the vulnerability does not affect Hadoop).

I know some dependencies can be especially troublesome to upgrade - I suspect that Maven's critical role in our build might make this risky - so if anyone has ideas for how to more completely test this than a full build, please chime in,
item.summary: Upgrade Maven and Maven Wagon versions

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Now Apache Maven 3.3+ is required to build Apache Hadoop. Do you want to update the minimum version to 3.4 or 3.5?

ajisakaa I'm only referring to the version of things like maven-core, etc. we depend on, not the maven version used to run the build. To get past the security issues involved, we need to update to 3.0.5 or higher. I would assume that unless there's a bug, that if we don't go above 3.3, it has no impact on what versions you can use to run the build.

Attaching a patch that does the minimum updates required by those 2 CVEs. We could also update to the latest of each - I tried that too, and the POM changes required (specifically the exclusions) are identical. But there's a risk of more unknown changes coming in and possibly requiring an otherwise unnecessary update of the Maven version required to build Hadoop.

 

I've run 'mvn site:site', 'mvn install -DskipTests -DskipShade', and 'mvn install -DskipShade' and there seem to be no problems. Happy to test more stuff if there's something this impacts that I'm missing.

-1 overall

Thanks mackrorysd for the comment. Agreed to update the versions.
The patch mostly looks good to me. One comment: Do we need to exclude maven-artifact-transfer dependency from maven-shade-plugin? It seems maven-shade-plugin does not have maven-artifact-transfer dependency.
Thanks ajisakaa - good catch. I removed that exclusion and double-checked the others were each individually necessary.
